    Visualize ‘supreme’ objects

    2019-08-22

    visualize-supreme-objects.Rmd

    This vignette is about styling graphs created from supreme objects.

    paths <- example_app_path()
s <- supreme(src_file(paths))
s
#> A supreme model object
#> 6 entities: server, customers_tab_module_server, items_tab_module_server, items_plot_server, ...

    Create entity-relationship diagram:

    graph(s)

    Style graph:

    # graph(s, style = list(name = "server", fill = "#ff0", linetype = "dashed"))

    Example: Style modules whose name ending with ‘slider’:

    #s_df <- as.data.frame(s) # turn supreme object to data.frame
#graph(s, style = list(name = grep("^slider", s_df$name), fill = "#ff0"))

    A good use of changing styles could be for focusing on particular modules. An example tries to make parent and child of a module explicit:

    # arrange parent & child

    You can have a custom options for the graph:

    # graph(s, options = list(
#   direction = "right", 
#   fontSize = 10, 
#   title = "Model customer plot")
# )

    You can also use %>% pipes from the magrittr package:

    supreme(src_file(paths)) %>%
  graph()

    Developed by Metin Yazici.

    Site built with pkgdown 1.3.0.
